chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12
1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott A Knuuttila was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13 [Modifiers: Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence currently serving

superMiscConds.notes: If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy.

No contact with the victim or her family. No contact with any minors unless express approval by supervising agent. Do not to purchase, possess, or view pornography of any type. Do not to possess any type of photography or video equipment.

Not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. Successfully complete Sex Offender Treatment. Successful completion of any programming deemed appropriate by the Department. Register and comply with Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry Program.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Order Regarding Motion for Post Conviction Relief /s/ PB 12/15/21 
This Court finds that Mr. Knuuttila the defendant, is procedurally barred from filing a Motion for Post Conviction Relief pursuant to 974.06 in this Court and therefore this Court summarily dismisses his motion filed August 2nd 2021.
(mailed to defendant on 12/16/21 sp)
2 CD's returned from the COA

IT IS ORDERED that the judgment is summarily affirmed.  WIS STAT RULE 809.21.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that attorney Susan E Alesia is relieved of her obligation to further represent Scott Knuuttila in this matter.  See WIS STAT RULE 809.32(3)
IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.

records.addlTxt: Count 1

Defendant Scott A Knuuttila in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Defendant Scott A Knuuttila in custody.  Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:18 p.m. Court calls the case, states appearances. 
This is a sentencing hearing. 
State has complied with the Victim Notification requirements. 
Both parties have received copy of the PSI. 
Attorney Wallace makes statements regarding PSI. 

Attorney Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Attorney Wallace makes sentencing arguments to the Court.
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
30 years Imprisonment. 20 years initial confinement, 10 years extended supervision.
Sentence to be served consecutively to any other sentence currently serving. 
0 days credit credit.
Not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 
No contact with the victim or her family
No contact with any minors unless express approval by supervising agent
Successfully complete Sex Offender Treatment.
Successful completion of any programming deemed appropriate by the Department
Register and comply with Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry Program.
Do not to purchase, possess, or view pornography of any type
Do not to possess any type of photography or video equipment. 
Pay costs.
Pay Victim witness surcharge
Pay DNA surcharge.

20 days to appeal. 
Parties to keep the PSI confidentially in their files.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on June 20, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Scott A Knuuttila, Inmate #638996 in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Defendant Scott A Knuuttila, Inmate #638996 in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin with ADA Daniel Hess.
8:45 a.m. Court calls the case. ADA Cousins states the appearances.
Court states matter is set for a Plea Hearing today, and Jury Trial is canceled.

ADA Cousins Amended Information has been filed in this case.
ADA Cousins states plea agreement.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Atty Wallace concurs with agreement stated.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of:
Count 1: No Contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Court orders a PSI.

Court questions Atty Wallace whether his client has ever had a PSI.
Atty Wallace stated he had a PSI done in Fond Du Lac.

BY THE COURT:  
PSI to be completed by June 06, 2017. Copies to be provided to the Parties.
Bond is revoked.
Sentencing hear set for 06/20/2017 at 1:30 p.m.

Defendant Scott A Knuuttila in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Defendant Scott A Knuuttila in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:28 a.m. ADA Cousins calls the case and states the appearances.
Matter before the Court for a Pre-Trial Motions.

Motion to Uphold Plea Offer.
Atty Wallace makes statements regarding the motion.
ADA Cousin responds.
Atty Wallace replies.

**BY THE COURT:
For reasons stated on the record, Defense Motion is denied.

Motion for the introdution of prior convictions by the defendant.
Atty Wallace makes statements.

**BY THE COURT:
If the defendant testifies, the number of convictions is 2.

Motion for Audio/Video Testimony.
ADA Cousins requests this motion be dismissed.

**BY THE COURT:
Motion for Audio/Video testimony is dismissed.

Motion for Admission of Other Acts Evidence.
ADA Cousins makes statements regarding the motion.
Court seeks clarification.
Court receives Response from Atty Wallace.
Atty Wallace summarizes his Response for the Court.
Court takes a moment to review.
Court reads Jury Instructions.

**BY THE COURT:
For reasons stated on the record,  the Motion for Admission of Other Acts Evidence is granted.
Jury Trial is to continue as scheduled. Attys to be in Court by 7:45 a.m.

Scheduling Order /s/ TTF 12/12/16

Motion hearing on January 27, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial on March 30, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on April 18, 2017 at 08:00 am.
Jury trial on March 28, 2017 at 08:00 am.

Attorney John H. Wallace in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:20 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court questions Atty Wallace.  Defendant is to appear by telephone. 
Atty Wallace indicates the defendant will be available at 3:00. 
Court will not move forward until the defendant is available. 

Court will continue the matter to 3:00 p.m.  
1:21 p.m.  Court is in recess.

2:48 p.m.  Court is back in session. 
Attorney John H. Wallace in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Scott Knuutila appears by phone. 
Atty Wallace makes arguments in support of the Motion to Adjourn the Trial. 
Court responds to the statements made re: policies with regards to amendment of charges. 
Atty Cousins makes arguments in opposition of the motion and settlement negotiations.

BY THE COURT:    For reasons stated on the record, the Court will grant the motion for adjournment at this time. 

Court questions the parties re: length of trial. 
Atty Cousins believes the trial would remain 2 days. 
Atty Wallace believes the trial could go for 4 days. 

Court questions Atty Wallace re: remaining on the case. 
Atty Wallace indicates he needs to speak with his client but will advise the court. 

BY THE COURT:  
Any change of counsel is to be done by the end of this year.  Court does not want a last minute change of attorney to delay this case further. 
Motions re: plea agreement are to be filed by the end of this year as well.
Motion to Adjourn Trial filed by Atty John Wallace III

Defendant Scott A Knuuttila in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Defendant Scott A Knuuttila in custody. Elizabeth Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing at 10-19-2015 03:00 pm
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  E.G.K, S.R.K. or any other minor child(ren) and ordered as conditions of confinement.

Defendant Scott A Knuuttila in court, in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:23 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Defendant indicates that he spoke with someone at the Public Defender and has been determined to be eligible but he has not yet spoken with anyone.

Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Atty Cousins states the facts in this case and is recommending a $250,000.00 cash bond with conditions as stated on the record.
Defendant does not wish to make any statements prior to bond being entered.

BY THE COURT:  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Scott A Knuuttila not in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. New Writ will need to be done.
****4:33 p.m. Court recalls case as Defendant was in Jail from a Writ. Defendant states he really hasn't seen the complaint.  Defendant states his wife mailed it to his Fond du Lac.  Court reschedules case to tomorrow to allow time for Defendant to review complaint.
